title: What the Speech Means for 2014
abstract: The impact of President Obama’s speech on the midterms, his agenda and his relationship with Congress.

title: NATO's Rasmussen Criticizes Russian Pressure on Ukraine
abstract: NATO Secretary General Anders Fogh Rasmussen criticized Russia on Wednesday for pressuring Kiev not to sign a free trade pact with the European Union, a move that triggered mass protests.

title: Luxury Home Boom to Change Face of London
abstract: The face of London is about to change.

title: Frozen Foie Gras? Quelle Horreur!
abstract: France, known as a world capital of gastronomy, is considering a consumer protection law that would require restaurants to designate fresh dishes as homemade.

title: South Korea Approves $7 Billion Reactor Plans in Boost for Nuclear Power
abstract: South Korea approved on Wednesday a $7 billion project to build two nuclear plants, a boost for an industry struggling to emerge from the shadow of Japan's Fukushima disaster and the first approval since a policy review sparked by a safety scandal at domestic reactors.

title: Pentagon Report Sees Delays in Testing of New Boeing Tanker
abstract: A new Boeing Co aerial tanker that will refuel warplanes during flight is expected to see operational testing slip by at least 6 to 12 months, according to a U.S. Defense Department report due to be officially released on Wednesday.

title: After Crisis, Greeks Work to Promote ‘Social’ Economy
abstract: Businesses tired of dealing with bureaucrats and failing corporations are relying on volunteer networks to provide cheaper goods and to sell directly to customers.
